title: Amazon.com is sued over alleged sale of contaminated rice By Reuters
summary: Amazon.com is facing a lawsuit for allegedly selling rice products contaminated with arsenic and other heavy metals. The lawsuit, filed in Seattle federal court, covers 18 types of rice, including brands like Ben’s Original and Whole Foods’ 365, and seeks damages of at least $5 million.

title: Oracle to buy $40 billion of Nvidia chips for OpenAI’s US data center, FT reports By Reuters
summary: Oracle plans to buy $40 billion worth of Nvidia chips to power OpenAI's new data center in the U.S., aiming to bolster its cloud computing capabilities and reduce OpenAI's dependence on Microsoft.

title: Amazon not seeing notable impact from tariffs yet, Q2 revenue tracking higher By Investing.com
summary: Amazon is not experiencing a significant impact from tariffs, and its second-quarter revenue is tracking higher than expected.

title: Wall St falls as Trump tariff threats spark market uncertainty By Reuters
summary: U.S. stocks fell on Friday following President Donald Trump's recommendation of 50% tariffs on European goods, which reopened global trade tensions and caused market uncertainty. Technology and consumer discretionary stocks, including Amazon, were among the biggest losers.

title: Celebrities unite at exclusive Cannes gala to support AIDS research after Trump cuts By Reuters
summary: Celebrities gathered at an exclusive Cannes gala to raise funds for AIDS research, expressing concerns over U.S. President Donald Trump's budget cuts affecting global AIDS research and prevention. The event highlighted the critical role of amfAR in advocacy and research, with notable attendees including Jeff Bezos' fiancee, Lauren Sanchez.

title: Disney seeks to stop YouTube from hiring veteran to oversee sports and media By Reuters
summary: Disney is suing YouTube to prevent the hiring of Justin Connolly, a long-time Disney executive, alleging breach of contract. YouTube has been expanding its live sports portfolio, competing with other platforms like Amazon.

title: Ackman’s hedge fund Pershing Square bets on Amazon, exits Canadian Pacific By Reuters
summary: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman's hedge fund, Pershing Square, has acquired shares in Amazon, expressing confidence in the company's ability to manage tariff impacts and praising CEO Andrew Jassy's efficiency. The fund also made adjustments to its portfolio, including exiting Canadian Pacific and adding stakes in Hertz and Uber.

title: U.S. stocks mixed at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.00% By Investing.com
summary: U.S. stocks closed mixed with the Dow Jones Industrial Average remaining unchanged, the S&P 500 declining slightly, and the NASDAQ Composite gaining. Notable performers included Amazon.com Inc (AMZN), which rose 0.99%, and significant declines in stocks like Enphase Energy Inc and Humana Inc.

title: Amazon stock rises following Pershing Square’s stake reveal By Investing.com
summary: Amazon (AMZN) shares rose 1.5% after Bill Ackman's Pershing Square revealed a new stake in the company, citing the strategic value of Amazon's dual business model and the attractive entry point due to recent price dips. Pershing Square highlighted the strength of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the retail segment's ubiquity, expressing confidence in Amazon's future performance.

title: Amazon tests AI audio summaries for products, expanding tech giant’s AI push (May 21) By Reuters
summary: Amazon is testing AI-powered audio summaries for products, continuing its push to integrate AI across its platforms. This feature, along with other AI tools like Alexa+ and Rufus, aims to enhance the shopping experience for customers.

title: Startup Anthropic says its new AI model can code for hours at a time By Reuters
summary: Anthropic, a startup backed by Google-parent Alphabet and Amazon.com, has released a new AI model capable of autonomous coding for extended periods. This advancement is seen as a significant milestone in AI autonomy and productivity.

title: Google faces DOJ probe over Character.AI deal, Bloomberg Law reports By Reuters
summary: The U.S. Justice Department is investigating whether Google's agreement with Character.AI violates antitrust laws. The probe focuses on whether Google structured the deal to avoid formal merger scrutiny. Other tech giants, including Amazon, have made similar deals, drawing regulatory attention.

title: US climate pullback threatens planned debt-for-nature deals By Reuters
summary: The article discusses the potential unraveling of debt-for-nature swaps due to the withdrawal of U.S. backing under President Donald Trump. These swaps, which have been crucial for conservation efforts and debt reduction in various countries, are now at risk as key players like the DFC step back from climate-related work.

title: Wall Street stocks end mostly flat in choppy trade as Treasury yields ease By Reuters
summary: U.S. stocks ended Thursday's session mostly flat after a choppy trading day, with Treasury yields easing off recent highs following the passage of President Trump’s tax and spending bill. Despite concerns over the U.S. deficit and tariffs, megacap growth stocks, including Amazon, saw gains.

title: Stock market today: S&P 500 ends flat as US debt concerns weigh on sentiment By Investing.com
summary: The S&P 500 ended flat due to concerns over U.S. debt levels, despite dip-buying in tech stocks. The House passed a tax and spending bill, while jobless claims indicated a solid labor market. Urban Outfitters and Analog Devices reported strong earnings, and Nike announced plans to raise prices and sell on Amazon.
